1.title: Pilot
1.plot: It's day one for Alan McKussic at Riverside Community Church, and aside from introducing himself to a reticent congregation he also struggles to locate a Jr. High student who is looking to sabotage Alan's plans of having a normal first day of work.

2.title: ...And the Angels Sing
2.plot: Alan decides to join the church choir once he finds out that Dana is a member. To his dismay he discovers that Shane, Pete, Roosey and the infamous Madril family are members as well and they don't seem too keen about letting Alan join.

3.title: Stuck
3.plot: Alan, Dana, Marsh and Shane have accidentally locked themselves in a conference room. With no one around to save them the gang turns to Pete Dominico to try and attempt a break-out.

4.title: Sex-Ed
4.plot: Alan's sister is in town to visit and decides to tag along with him for Shane's sexual education seminar, only to discover that his lack of knowledge and loosely racial terminology is turning an already awkward situation into a nightmare.

5.title: The Last Supper
5.plot: It's dinner at Pastor Mitchell's and the staff at Riverside find themselves going after each others throats when Shane reveals a secret that a couple members of the staff were attempting to keep under wraps.

imdb.plot outline: Alan McKussic is a down on his luck and out of work screenwriter that needs to find a job. Unfortunately, the only position available to him requires the use of his old skills as a CPA. The only thing worse for Alan than having to do a job that he hates is where he has to do it: Riverside Church, a very uptight, conservative establishment that is not too keen on outsiders. Alan, along with his new friend and co-worker Nick "Marsh" Marshall try their best to survive on a day to day basis as well as dodging the oddballs and nut jobs of the congregation who are all gunning for their jobs...as well as sanity.
imdb.title: Church People
plot: A comedy set inside the grounds of a very conservative church which follows a failing screenwriter and his daily struggle of dealing with the oddballs and out of control circumstances that occur on a daily basis.::Sam Jones

Alan McKussic is a down on his luck and out of work screenwriter that needs to find a job. Unfortunately, the only position available to him requires the use of his old skills as a CPA. The only thing worse for Alan than having to do a job that he hates is where he has to do it: Riverside Church, a very uptight, conservative establishment that is not too keen on outsiders. Alan, along with his new friend and co-worker Nick "Marsh" Marshall try their best to survive on a day to day basis as well as dodging the oddballs and nut jobs of the congregation who are all gunning for their jobs...as well as sanity.::Elizabeth Rose
